titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3450) to implement the North American Free Trade Agreement.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-369, by Mr. Beilenson.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3450 with 8 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions. The bill shall be considered in the Committee of the Whole. The eight hours of debate shall be controlled as follows: Rostenkowski, two hours in support of the bill; Gephardt, two hours in opposition; Michel, two hours in support; Solomon, two hours in opposition. Bill is closed to amendments. No amendment to the bill is in order.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 122.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 342 - 85 (Roll no. 573).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 11/16/1993--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 3450 (implementing the North American Free Trade Agreement).
